ygData.subject: FW: [eqenchanters] Re: FW: [eqenchanters] Re: Question on enchant er pets
ygData.msgSnippet: Good point. With my mage, my pets would be scared are run away from reds. but with my necro, my pets will fight to death no matter what, not afraid of a
ygData.messageBody:
Good point. With my mage, my pets would be scared are run away from reds.
but with my necro, my pets will fight to death no matter what, not afraid of
a griffin to save my ass...
I know how enchanter's pets behave but what about Charmed creatures?
Thanks,
Skara

-----Original Message-----
From: Brian Rittermann [mailto:bpr@...]
Sent: Wednesday, April 21, 1999 2:06 PM
To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
Subject: [eqenchanters] Re: FW: [eqenchanters] Re: Question on enchanter
pets


From: "Brian Rittermann" <bpr@...>

Charmed creatures are indeed able to be commanded. Enchanter pets, though
in permanent follow mode, will engage ANY creature if it attacks you (unlike
other pets who just wont fight). The enchanter pet is loyal until death.
It will not run.

Loreweaver


-----Original Message-----
From: DeGirolami, Franck <degirolami@...>
To: Eqenchanters (E-mail) <eqenchanters@onelist.com>
Date: Wednesday, April 21, 1999 4:57 PM
Subject: [eqenchanters] FW: [eqenchanters] Re: Question on enchanter pets


>From: "DeGirolami, Franck" <degirolami@...>
>
>What about charmed creatures?
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Miller, Keith A. [mailto:keithm@...]
>Sent: Wednesday, April 21, 1999 2:00 PM
>To: 'eqenchanters@onelist.com'
>Subject: [eqenchanters] Re: Question on enchanter pets
>
>
>From: "Miller, Keith A." <keithm@...>
>
>Pets are in permanent /pet follow mode. They accept no commands.
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Daniel Andersen [mailto:dea@...]
>Sent: Wednesday, April 21, 1999 3:43 PM
>To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
>Subject: [eqenchanters] Question on enchanter pets
>
>
>From: Daniel Andersen <dea@...>
>
>
> I have a question regarding enchanter pets. So far as I can
>tell, our pets do not listen to /pet commands. I've never really used
>pets
>before, so perhaps I'm doing things incorrectly, but it actually would
>make sense to me if they didn't. I mean, they are supposed to be
>mindless
>animations, right?
>
> If anyone has had different experiences, I'd love to hear about
>them. Thanks in advance.
>
